required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Oral Collagen Tripeptide on Skin Moisture and Wrinkles in Adult Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Oral Collagen Tripeptide on Skin Moisture and Wrinkles in Adult Women

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of a randomized, double-blind, and control-group study for the effect of oral ingestion of collagen tripeptides derived from fish on dermal moistures and wrinkles body fat reduction in participants

detailed_description.textblock: The aim is to investigate the effect of oral ingestion of collagen tripeptides derived from fish on dermal moistures and wrinkles body fat reduction in participants by a randomized, double-blind, and control-group study.

primary_outcome.measure: changes in Transepidermal Waterloss by Tewameter
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: comparison between baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in skin wrinkling indices by Visiometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: comparison between baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: comparison between baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in hydration level of the skin surface by Corneometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: comparison between baseline, after 6 weeks, and after 12 weeks

arm_group.description: 1,000 mg of collagen tripeptide (CTP) was orally administered per day for 12 weeks.
1,000 mg of placebo (starch) was orally administered per day for 12 weeks

intervention.description: 1,000 mg of CTP was orally administered per day for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > = 4 of Tewameter
Exclusion Criteria:
- Within the last 6 months, took skin surgery including cosmetic purpose
- Diabetic patients with poor glycemic control with a fasting blood glucose of 160 mg/dl or more
- Creatinine levels: more than twice the normal upper limit
- AST (GOT) or ALT (GPT) levels: more than twice the normal upper limit
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- sun allergy or sensitive skin
- functional cosmetics that affect dermal moistures and wrinkles within the last 3 months.
- If you have participated or are planning to participate in another clinical trial within the past month
- Alcohol abuser
- If they are pregnant or lactating or have a pregnancy plan during the clinical trial Those with allergic reactions to the constituent food
- Any person deemed inappropriate by the researcher for other reasons

overall_official.affiliation: Integrated Research Institute for Natural Ingredients and Functional Foods

facility.name: Integrated Research Institute for Natural Ingredients and Functional Foods

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Professor, Head of Integrated Research Institute for Natural Ingredients and Functional Foods (IRINIF)
